titles.title: First measurement of the <math><msub><mi>ν</mi><mi>μ</mi></msub></math> charged-current cross section on a water target without pions in the final state

abstracts.value: This paper reports the first differential measurement of the charged-current interaction cross section of <math><msub><mi>ν</mi><mi>μ</mi></msub></math> on water with no pions in the final state. This flux-averaged measurement has been made using the T2K experiment’s off-axis near detector, and is reported in doubly differential bins of muon momentum and angle. The flux-averaged total cross section in a restricted region of phase space was found to be <math><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.95</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>0.08</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>stat</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>±</mo><mn>0.06</mn><mo>(</mo><mtext>det syst</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>0.04</mn><mo>(</mo><mtext>model syst</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>0.08</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mtext>flux</mtext></mrow><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup><mrow><mi>cm</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>/</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow></math>.
